directory: Path to directory of dumps and final dcat file
api-enabled: Is API access activated for the MediaWiki installation?, boolean
dumps-enabled: Is JSON dump generation activated for the WikiBase installation?, boolean
uri: URL used as basis for rdf identifiers, e.g. http://www.example.org/about
catalog-homepage: URL for catalog homepage, e.g. http://www.example.org
catalog-issued: ISO data at which the catalog was first issued, e.g. 2000-12-24
catalog-license: License of the catalog, i.e. of the dcat-ap file itself, e.g. http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/
catalog-info: URL for json containing formatted i18n strings for catalog title and description. Can be an on-wiki page, e.g. https://www.wikidata.org/w/index.php?title=User:Lokal_Profil/DCAT.json&action=raw
keywords: Array of keywords describing all of the datasets
themes: Array of thematic ids in accordance with http://eurovoc.europa.eu/, e.g.

publisher.name: Name of the publisher
publisher.email: Contact e-mail for publisher, should be a function address, e.g. info@example.org

contactPoint.vcardType: Type of contact point: Organization or Individual
contactPoint.name: Name of the contact point
contactPoint.email: E-mail for contact point, should ideally be a function address, e.g. support@example.org

ld-info.accessURL: URL to the content negotiation endpoint of the WikiBase installation, e.g. http://www.example.org/entity/
ld-info.mediatype: Object of media types available through content negotiation in the format name:media-type (per http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/)
ld-info.license: License of the data in the distribution, e.g. http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/

api-info.accessURL: URL to the MediaWiki API endpoint of the wiki, e.g. http://www.example.org/w/api.php
api-info.mediatype: Object of non-deprecated formats available thorough the API, see ld-info:mediatype for formatting

dump-info.accessURL: URL to the directory where the .json.gz files reside ($1 is replaced on the fly by the actual .json.gz file) , e.g. http://example.org/dumps/$1
